_header: Love will I without any variance
Bibliographic Ghosts: Oxford, Bodleian Library Ashmole 191, Part IV (SC 6668), f. 195v.

BodAsh1393.First Lines:
loue well I withoute eny variauncetrewly to serue with all
                    louelynesse
BodAsh1393.Last Lines:
for yn hit is triste and [g]entilnesseAnd þat may man honour
                    & avaunce
BodAsh1393.Note:
One stanza, abba, with beginning of repeated stanza marked for tenor
                    part.
BodAsh1393.Editions:
Stainer,  Sir John, John Stainer,  C. Stainer,   and  Edward Williams Byron Nicholson.  
             Early Bodleian music; sacred & secular songs, together with other
                MS. compositions in the Bodleian Library, Oxford, ranging from about A.D. 1185 to
                about A.D. 1505.
         London, 1901; repr. Farnborough, Hants, England: Gregg, 1967: 2.61-2.
Black,  William Henry. 
             Catalogi Codicum Manuscriptorum Bibliothecae Bodleianae…Pars X,
                A…Catalogue of the Manuscripts bequeathed…by Elias Ashmole.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1845: 1086.
Robbins,  Rossell Hope,
                        ed.  
             Secular Lyrics of the XIV and XV Centuries.
